One such victim was next-generation business software developer ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW), which saw its stock absorb a more than 5% blow to its share price that day.  Well before market open, Kash Rangan from influential investment bank Goldman Sachs reset his fair value assessment on ServiceNow.  According to reports, Rangan's adjustment comes from his belief that ServiceNow might take a hit to its fundamentals in both its second quarter, and across the entirety of this year.
